Projects

Weather App

This application allows the user to input any location and recieve the current forecast for that location! It will include the temperature it is outside, what temperature it feels like, the humidity, and the visibility. It accomplishes this by using two APIs, which are linked to in the Weather App's About page. Click here to visit the Weather App

Recipe App

Users must sign up and create an account by inserting their name, email, and creating a new password. This application allows users to save their own recipes as well as edit them and delete them. Users are also able to sort their recipe by type (which is the default sorting method), alphabetically, and by last created. The database is on Heroku so logging in will take a bit of time but afterwards everything will work normally. Click here to visit the Recipe App

Charity Microservice

Users can use this api via postman, insomnia, or in their backend to get charities and save their favorites. This microservice has the documentation for all of the endpoints. Users are also able to sort charities by category or search them by ein. The microservice is hosted on Heroku. Click here to visit the Charity Microservice.

Solar System App

This application was made using React, Node.js, and Firebase! It provides information to users about our solar system. One can look at the moons or the planets in our solar system and learn more about them. Because this is hosted on heroku, it may take a while for the website to boot up when first visiting it. Click here to visit the Solar System App
